result.execSummary:
The defendant Mario S Murphy was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mario S Murphy

records.addlTxt: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Rights

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Mario S Murphy in court, in custody.  Attorney Will Anderson for Paul M Fredrickson in court for Mario S Murphy.  Attorney Will R Davis in court for State of Wisconsin.  Jt: plea ct 1. 2 years probation. Argument. No restitution. Statement by DE. DNA on file. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #   1
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for  1 years, cc to 21CF1244, cs to 19CF1090

CONDITIONS:

-Not use/possess alcohol, drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-No contact with: BF, RS, MM, SM or any of their residences or employment 
-No threats/acts of violence against: anyone

-Random UA and BA testing at a minimum of every 2 weeks
-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
-Psychiatric evaluation as deemed appropriate by agent and treatment as recommended

-Shall not enter any establishment whose primary purpose is alcohol.
-Shall not live anywhere there is alcohol

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved

-Days credit for time already served:  16 (8/24/22 - 9/8/22)
-Days credit if revoked: 16

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes emailed to DOC.

Becky K.
and notice of DNA and witness list - State's

- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Shannon M
- Defendant shall not be in the 1000 block of Park Cir in Sun Prairie.
Trial Judge - Br 11

2:54 PM Defendant Mario S Murphy in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Mario S Murphy.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
